bluecat_endpoint.description: The BlueCat Address Manager endpoint hostname. Can also use the environment variable `BLUECAT_ENDPOINT`

password.description: The BlueCat Address Manager password. Can also use the environment variable `BLUECAT_PASSWORD`

ssl_verify.description: Verify the SSL certificate of the BlueCat Address Manager endpoint? Defaults to `true`.

username.description: A BlueCat Address Manager username. Can also use the environment variable `BLUECAT_USERNAME`

absolute_name.description: The absolute name (fqdn) of the host record.

addresses.description: The address(es) to be associated with the host record.

comments.description: Comments to be associated with the host record. Defaults to ``.

custom_properties.description: A map of all custom properties associated with the host record.

dns_zone.description: The DNS zone to create the host record in. Combined with `name` to make the fqdn.  If changed, forces a new resource.

name.description: The name of the host record to be created. Combined with `dns_zone` to make the fqdn.

properties.description: The properties of the host record as returned by the API (pipe delimited).

reverse_record.description: If a reverse record should be created for addresses. Defaults to `true`.

ttl.description: The TTL for the host record.  When set to -1, ignores the TTL. Defaults to `-1`.

view_id.description: The object ID of the View that host record should be created in. If changed, forces a new resource.

action.description: The action to take on the next available IPv4 address.  Must be one of: "MAKE_STATIC", "MAKE_RESERVED", or "MAKE_DHCP_RESERVED". If changed, forces a new resource. Defaults to `MAKE_STATIC`.

address.description: The IPv4 address that was allocated.

configuration_id.description: The object ID of the Configuration that will hold the new address. If changed, forces a new resource.

custom_properties.description: A map of all custom properties associated with the IPv4 address.

mac_address.description: The MAC address to associate with the IPv4 address. Defaults to ``.

name.description: The name assigned to the IPv4 address. This is not related to DNS.

parent_id.description: The object ID of the Configuration, Block, or Network to find the next available IPv4 address in. If changed, forces a new resource.

properties.description: The properties of the IPv4 address as returned by the API (pipe delimited).

state.description: The state of the IPv4 address.

block.description: Resource to reserve an IPv4 address.

keepers.description: An arbitrary map of values. If this argument is changed, then the resource will be recreated.

network_id.description: The network ID of the network selected by the resource.

network_id_list.description: A list of Network IDs to search for a free IP address. By default, the address with the most free addresses will be returned. See the `random` argument for another selection method. The resource will be recreated if the network_id_list is changed. You may want to use a `lifecycle` customization to ignore changes to the list after resource creation so that a new network is not selected if the list is changed.

random.description: By default, the network with the most free IP addresses is returned. By setting this to `true` a random network from the list will be returned instead. The network will be validated to have at least 1 free IP address. Defaults to `false`.

seed.description: A seed for the `random` argument's generator. Can be used to try to get more predictable results from the random selection. The results will not be fixed however.

block.description: Resource to select an IPv4 network from a list of networks based on availability of IP addresses.

addresses_free.description: The number of addresses unallocated/free on the network.

addresses_in_use.description: The number of addresses allocated/in use on the network.

cidr.description: The CIDR address of the IPv4 network.

default_view.description: The object id of the default DNS View for the network.

gateway.description: The gateway of the IPv4 network.

inherit_allow_duplicate_host.description: Duplicate host names check is inherited.

inherit_ping_before_assign.description: The network pings an address before assignment is inherited.

is_larger_allowed.description: (Optional) Is it ok to return a network that is larger than the size specified? Defaults to `false`.

name.description: The display name of the IPv4 network.

parent_id.description: The object ID of the parent object that will contain the new IPv4 network. If this argument is changed, then the resource will be recreated.

ping_before_assign.description: The network pings an address before assignment.

properties.description: The properties of the resource as returned by the API (pipe delimited).

size.description: The size of the IPv4 network expressed as a power of 2. For example, 256 would create a /24. If this argument is changed, then the resource will be recreated.

traversal_method.description: The traversal method used to find the range to allocate the network. Must be one of "NO_TRAVERSAL", "DEPTH_FIRST", or "BREADTH_FIRST". Defaults to `NO_TRAVERSAL`.

block.description: Resource to create an IPv4 network.

name.description: The name of the entity to find.

parent_id.description: The object ID of the parent object that contains the entity. Configurations are stored in ID `0`. Defaults to `0`.

properties.description: The properties of the entity as returned by the API (pipe delimited).

type.description: The type of the entity you want to retrieve.

block.description: Data source to access the attributes of a BlueCat entity.

absolute_name.description: The absolute name/fqdn of the host record.

address_ids.description: A set of all address ids associated with the host record.

addresses.description: A set of all addresses associated with the host record.

custom_properties.description: A map of all custom properties associated with the host record.

name.description: The short name of the host record.

parent_id.description: The ID of the parent of the host record.

parent_type.description: The type of the parent of the host record.

properties.description: The properties of the host record as returned by the API (pipe delimited).

result_count.description: The number of results the API should return. This must be between 1 and 10.  You most likely want to leave this alone. Defaults to `10`.

reverse_record.description: A boolean that represents if the host record should set reverse records.

start.description: The start index of the search results the API should return. You most likely want to leave this alone. Defaults to `0`.

ttl.description: The TTL of the host record.

block.description: Data source to access the attributes of a host record. If the API returns more than one host record that matches, an error will be returned.

address.description: The IPv4 address to get data for.

container_id.description: The object ID of the container that has the specified `address`.  This can be a Configuration, IPv4 Block, IPv4 Network, or DHCP range.

custom_properties.description: A map of all custom properties associated with the IPv4 address.

mac_address.description: The MAC address associated with the IPv4 address.

name.description: The name assigned to the IPv4 address.  This is not related to DNS.

properties.description: The properties of the IPv4 address as returned by the API (pipe delimited).

state.description: The state of the IPv4 address.

block.description: Data source to access the attributes of an IPv4 address.

addresses_free.description: The number of addresses unallocated/free on the network.

addresses_in_use.description: The number of addresses allocated/in use on the network.

cidr.description: The CIDR address of the IPv4 network.

container_id.description: The object ID of a container that contains the specified IPv4 network.

custom_properties.description: A map of all custom properties associated with the IPv4 network.

default_view.description: The object id of the default DNS View for the network.

gateway.description: The gateway of the IPv4 network.

inherit_allow_duplicate_host.description: Duplicate host names check is inherited.

inherit_default_view.description: The default DNS View is inherited.

inherit_ping_before_assign.description: The network pings an address before assignment is inherited.

ping_before_assign.description: The network pings an address before assignment.

properties.description: The properties of the resource as returned by the API (pipe delimited).

block.description: Data source to access the attributes of an IPv4 network from a hint based search.

address.description: IP address to find the IPv4 network, IPv4 Block, or DHCPv4 Range of.

addresses_free.description: The number of addresses unallocated/free on the network.

addresses_in_use.description: The number of addresses allocated/in use on the network.

cidr.description: The CIDR address of the IPv4 network.

container_id.description: The object ID of a container that contains the specified IPv4 network, block, or range.

custom_properties.description: A map of all custom properties associated with the IPv4 network.

default_view.description: The object id of the default DNS View for the network.

gateway.description: The gateway of the IPv4 network.

inherit_allow_duplicate_host.description: Duplicate host names check is inherited.

inherit_default_view.description: The default DNS View is inherited.

inherit_ping_before_assign.description: The network pings an address before assignment is inherited.

ping_before_assign.description: The network pings an address before assignment.

properties.description: The properties of the resource as returned by the API (pipe delimited).

type.description: Must be "IP4Block", "IP4Network", "DHCP4Range", or "". "" will find the most specific container.

block.description: Data source to access the attributes of an IPv4 network, IPv4 Block, or DHCPv4 Range from an IPv4 address.
